column1: Glanzmann disease is a rare disorder of blood platelets, which results in easy bruising and nosebleeds.
There is no specific treatment for this disorder.
Platelet transfusions may be given to people who are having severe bleeding.
Anyone with a bleeding disorder should avoid taking aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as ibuprofen and naproxen.
Complications may include: - Severe bleeding - Iron deficiency anemia in menstruating women due to abnormally heavy bleeding
Call your health care provider if: - You have bleeding or bruising of an unknown cause - Bleeding does not stop after usual treatments
